title: ATP roundup: Seppi ousts No. 5 seed Garin in Moscow
text:
Italian Andreas Seppi saved two match points in the second set and went on to outlast fifth-seeded Cristian Garin of Chile 3-6, 7-6 (2), 7-6 (4) on Monday to reach the second round of the Kremlin Cup in Moscow.

Seppi fought off the match points while serving down 6-5 in the second set. He failed to convert four match points of his own while trying to break at 6-5 in third set but finally prevailed on his second match point of the tiebreaker.

Seventh-seeded Adrian Mannarino of France defeated qualifier Damir Dzumhur of Bosnia 7-6 (2), 6-0, and Czech qualifier Lukas Rosol saved a match point in a second-set tiebreaker before getting past Argentina's Juan Ignacio Londero 6-7 (4), 7-6 (7), 6-3.

Intrum Stockholm Open

Despite firing 30 aces, sixth-seeded American Reilly Opelka fell to Italian Stefano Travaglia 7-5, 4-6, 6-4 in the first round in Stockholm, Sweden. Opelka was able to break serve only once.

Serbian Janko Tipsarevic began his final ATP Tour event by cruising past Frenchman Corentin Moutet 6-2, 6-4 in a 73-minute match. Tipsarevic, who has four tour titles and reached No. 8 in the world rankings in 2012, announced he will retire after the Davis Cup finals in November.

In the other first-round match, eighth-seeded Brit Daniel Evans fought off Bernard Tomic of Australia 6-4, 1-6, 6-3.

European Open

Fifth-seeded Guido Pella of Argentina advanced with a 5-7, 6-4, 7-6 (2) victory over Germany's Peter Gojowczyk in the first round in Antwerp, Belgium.

Pella didn't lose serve in the third-set tiebreaker and won the final three points in a match that lasted 2 hours, 27 minutes.

Sixth-seeded Frenchman Jo-Wilfried Tsonga, who won this event in 2017, opened with a 6-3, 6-4 victory over Italian Lorenzo Sonego.

--Field Level Media
description: Italian Andreas Seppi saved two match points in the second set and went on to  outlast fifth-seeded Cristian Garin of Chile 3-6, 7-6 (2), 7-6 (4) on Monday ...
